column4: I'm doing an ubuntu server install and after entering my desired hostname, the screen cleared the text-UI and isn't doing anything. Is it just loading or what?
use alt+left to switch to another virtual terminal, repeat until you find one with logging/reporting lines, there you can see what is gong on
last message was netcfg[12916]: DEBUG: Success!
so the primary virtual terminal that's supposed to display the UI just seems to be printing the characters typed.
do you already get a screen with something like  "press <enter> to open a console"  ?
you can log in there and have a look at the system
because you already have a running linux system during install
more of how do I work with this?
I thought you wanted to know if your install is stalled or not. This is how you can find out
yes, but I have no clue how to check that.
type   top - that might give you an overview of the running processes and the system load - just to determine what is going on
does    free give anything but an error?   in the meantime take another round through your VTs
`free` works just fine and the only thing that's happened to the status output is it's reporting me exiting and restarting the virtual terminal.
free was the wrong tool anyway :)    type    ps aux --sort=%cpu    to see what processes are running
well, I was just looking into `ps`, but I have to do something else. I'll be back around to work on this later.
